abstract: Supreme Court rules in two capital cases, remaining consistent with its approach to death penalty by reversing one death sentence and declining to test its constitutionality in another; Louisiana case, appeal involving convicted murderer Lamondre Tucker, in which court was asked to consider whether death penalty is constitutional, is turned down without comment; in Arizona case involving convicted kidnapper and killer Shawn P Lynch, court reverses death sentence in unsigned opinion.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Rules in Capital Cases, Overturning an Arizona Death Sentence
headline.main: Supreme Court Rules in Capital Cases, Overturning a Death Sentence

snippet: In one case, the court refused to consider the constitutionality of capital punishment but in another, it reversed an Arizona man’s death sentence.
lead_paragraph: In one case, the court refused to consider the constitutionality of capital punishment but in another, it reversed an Arizona man’s death sentence.
